column5: planning on fishing black bear lodge in red lake in late july or august appreciate your fishing experiences there;owner claims great walleye fishing within one mile from camp in the main bay;has anyone fished the 5 portage lakes (especially the muskie lake) and are they worth going to;all comments pro or con are appreciated jim wolf the chicago boys
I fished Suffel lake a couple of years ago, caught lots of walleyes until a storm blew us off the lake, nice lake, you won't be disappointed
minnow thanks for the input on suffel lake portage at black bear lodge jim wolf hopefully we can make a trip this year

Been going to BBL for 4 years now--always catch a lot of fish, most of them close to camp. We've portaged to NoName 3 every year--always plan to get around to the back side of the island, but never make it there: can't stop catching walleye long enough to make it around the corner!If you're looking for a no-frills lodge, I highly recommend Black Bear. Owners are great and the fishing is fantastic.Disclaimer: I haven't fished elsewhere in Canada, so can't compare to other lakes/lodges.
Should also mention that my son & I will be there last week of July/first week of Auguse--hope to see you there!
